document.full_text: u.s. auto sales in march are expected to rise about 12 percent from last year's depressed levels, but high gasoline prices and production problems caused by the japanese earthquake could slow a recovery, analysts and investors said.
document.title: u.s. march auto sales seen up, but gas prices weigh
lines_and_colors: u.s. auto sales in march are expected to rise about 12 percent from last year's depressed levels, but high gasoline prices and production problems caused by the japanese earthquake could slow a recovery, analysts and investors said.
